document_title: Joint stiffness: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
When joint stiffness persists, the patient may be prescribed a number of diagnostic tests such as:
Clinical health check: The doctor checks symptoms such as pain, redness, swelling, stiffness and the patient's normal range of activities. This will help the doctor determine the cause of the disease and consider performing some other tests to accurately diagnose the condition.; Blood test: This test will help your doctor check for joint stiffness. Blood tests will check erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ERS), C-reactive protein (CRP) to determine inflammation in the body. When rheumatoid arthritis is suspected, the doctor may order the patient to undergo an anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide (anti-CCP) test to confirm the diagnosis.; Imaging tests: The results of X-ray, ultrasound or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) will help the doctor examine the structures inside the joint and identify joint damage.
